Sure, he felt he could handle being left at home alone, but he understood that that just wasn’t in the cards. Anyway, it wasn’t so bad. His aunt was cool enough, and she didn’t live so far away that he couldn’t go to see his friends. He quite liked her, actually, and she was always very nice to him. Bobby liked his uncle, too, it was a shame he wasn’t around. They both liked kids, he wondered why they’d never had any of their own. He wasn’t quite sure why his parents were leaving so late at night for their trip. Apparently it meant that their plane tickets were cheaper, although he didn’t understand how that worked.

After they’d dropped him off at his aunt’s that Sunday night – they’d gone zipping away after only briefly stopping to say hello, which struck him as a bit rude - he’d had the requisite polite conversation with her, then gone up to bed. He unpacked his stuff, and set a photograph on top of a bureau. The photo showed two boys in basketball uniforms flanking a smiling girl.

He’d opened up his laptop, then accessed his aunt’s wi-fi and gone on-line. There was a Facebook message from his friend, Nicky O’Halloran, suggesting that they get together the next day. Nicky was the other boy in the photo. He was taller than Bobby, lanky with reddish hair and green eyes. Nicky had lived next door to Bobby their whole lives, and they’d been friends as far back as Bobby could remember. Nicky’s father had died when he was young, and his mother worked long hours, so Nicky spent a lot of time with the Thomsons, so much so that he was almost a part of the family. He did have an older brother, Stevie, who was out living on his own. Nicky and Bobby were both on their high school’s basketball team. This was, Bobby admitted, more a sign of how sad their school’s team was , than a sign of the pair of them being great athletes. Nicky could be a bit of a loudmouth sometimes, but he was basically OK.

There was also a message from Stephanie Belanger, who was the girl in the photo. She was a beautiful brunette, with brown eyes and a real gift for art. She and Bobby had been good friends since they had met on the first day of high school. Bobby very much wanted to be more than friends with her, but she had gently but firmly made it clear that while she liked him a lot, she wasn’t interested in a romantic relationship. Bobby did his best to swallow his disappointment so that they could remain friends, but deep inside he still really wished she felt for him the way he did for her. Nicky said he thought she was a lesbian (actually, he had used a much coarser term), but then, he said that about any girl that didn’t like him (which in practice meant most girls), so Bobby figured that Nicky was just projecting. Stephanie was asking his opinion of a painting she had done. That was one of many things he really liked about her – even though he was a jock of sorts, she still talked to him as though he had a brain.

Stephanie’s sister, Lorraine, who was one year older than her, was also a good artist, and the two of them would be spending the week at an artists’ seminar, so she wouldn’t be around until the weekend.

After sending responses to both of them, he undressed and pulled on the ratty old green bathrobe that was all he usually wore at night, and climbed into bed. He wondered what it would be like to have siblings. He thought it might be better than being an only child. He knew his mother would have liked to have had more children, but health issues had prevented that.
When he woke up early Monday morning, he felt something odd, as though a weight were pressing down on his chest. He opened his eyes and noticed two things right away:

1) He was now wearing what appeared to be a loose-fitting, black nightgown, of the sort that a teenage girl might wear.
and
2)There were two weights on his chest, weights the size and position of a pair of breasts!

What was going on? Had his aunt done this as some kind of a joke? How had she managed to do it without waking him up? He grasped the right “breast” firmly to try and wrench it off. Instead, he gave a high-pitched yelp of pain.

I – FELT – THAT!, he thought. I actually felt that! What’s going on?

He fumbled with the nightgown for a moment before realizing that it was the sort that zipped down the back. He unzipped it enough so that he could look down the front. They were real! There were real feminine breasts attached to his body! They were real and very SENsitive! He zipped the gown back up. He knew what he had to check next, but he was afraid. Eventually, he reached down and pulled up the bottom of the gown. When he saw between his legs, he groaned. His “equipment” was gone, replaced by what he recognized as a vagina (for all that he’d never seen one before in real life). He reached down and checked. It was real, too.

He sat in the bed in shock. How had this happened? Why had this happened? He ran his hand through hair that he now realized reached down to the small of his back.

I have to see, he thought.

Moving robotically, he got up out of the bed, and walked over to a full-length mirror on the other side of the room. Looking back at him was a girl about his own age – 16 – with long black hair with a red streak down one side. Her face reminded him of pictures he’d seen of his Aunt Mary – his father’s sister – when she’d been a teenager. The girl was not heavy, but thickset and curvy, with a respectable rack. Her nails – fingers and toes – were painted black. Overall, not the type he went for, but attractive enough. The name “June” came into his mind. His mother had once told him that if he’d been born a girl, he – well “she” – would have been called “June”.

At that moment, there was a knock at the door.

“Bobby?”, said Aunt Marla. “Are you OK in there? I thought I heard you yell.”

Bobby froze for a moment. What would his aunt say when she saw him like this? Would she even know him? But what else could he do?

“Aunt Marla?”, he said, trying to lower his voice as much as possible. “I think I have a problem.”

“Bobby, can I come in?”, his aunt asked.

“Sure.”

He steeled himself for her reaction as she came into the room. She stared at him open-mouthed.

“A-Aunt M-Marla?”, he said. I-It’s m-me, B-Bobby.”
141331.title: A Goth Girl!

choices: Bobby Doesn't Want to to Try
1413311.content:
She looked at him, doubtfully, then moved her head closer. Her eyes seemed to pierce right through him.

“Oh, Mother Goddess, Bobby, it is you! Oh, no – that room! I thought it was fixed! I should never have put you in there!”

“The room? Aunt Marla, what are you talking about? Did you know this would happen? Did you do this to me? You’ve got to tell me what’s happening!” Bobby’s voice shook. He was on the edge of hysteria.

Marla touched his forehead. “Bobby. Calm. Down.”

A wave of calm swept over Bobby. Suddenly, he relaxed.

“Auntie, how did you do that?”

“A simple spell.”

“A spell? What do you mean?”

“Come downstairs. We’ll have some breakfast.”

Marla put a robe on Bobby and led him to the kitchen. They had a hearty breakfast, and then Marla poured them both cups of tea.

“Bobby, the first thing you have to understand is that I’m not really your mother’s younger sister.”

“You mean, you’re adopted?”

“Not exactly. You could say I adopted myself into her family.”

“I don’t understand.”

Marla sighed.

“OK, here’s the big reveal, the part you’re going to find hard to believe. Well, maybe not so hard after how you woke up this morning. The truth is, I’m a witch. In fact, I’m the last witch on Earth. How old would guess I am?”

“I dunno. Late 30’s, 40, tops.”

“I’m four hundred years old. I’m not immortal – I’ve probably only got about a century left. It’s OK, it’s been a good life. When my time comes, I’ll go to be with my ancestors happily.”

“The last witch? What happened to all the others?”

“A long time ago, this world was filled with magic. Every magical being you’ve ever read about in a fairy tale existed, and more besides. Then, about two thousand years ago, something happened, no one ever knew what. Whatever it was, the world became increasingly less hospitable to magic. Magical beings began to die out. Finally, four hundred years ago, my parents were the last magical beings left on the Earth. Then I was born, the last new magical being born here. I’ve lived in this house ever since.”

“What? But this house isn’t four hundred years old!”

“Yes, it is, I’ve just ‘redecorated’ it over the years.”

“How did you become my mother’s sister?”

“Well, when you live as long as I do, you need a little protective camouflage, to keep people from finding out who you really are. So, I needed a family. I’d met your mother, and we’d become good friends. I told her who I was, and she agreed to be my sister. She was perfect for it. She was an only child, with no living close relatives. I cast a few spells, and I was your mother’s kid sister, at least as far as anyone else was concerned.”

“But you look a lot like my mother. Is that why you chose her?.”

“No, I used to look a lot different. I cast a spell to change my appearance.”

“Does Uncle Joe know about this?”

“No. I don’t like keeping a secret from him, but I thought it was for the best. I knew I could trust your mom to keep it a secret, but I knew that Joe would give it away without meaning to. I love Joe Vercotti, but he has no filter. As far as I can tell, he’s never picked up on it. That fact that our car has never broken down or crashed or even been ticketed, the fact that we’ve never been sick since we got engaged, my uncanny ability to pick Super Bowl and World Series winners – he’s put all of that down to clean living and good luck. We could never have children, of course, there would be…problems…with that. But otherwise we’ve had a nice, normal life.”

“OK, but how does this relate to what happened to me? You said something about that room.”

“Well, you have to understand, my father was kind of a conflicted man. Honestly, I think he was a bit unhinged by being one of the last magical beings. My mother dealt with it well enough, but he didn’t handle it well at all. Father wasn’t all bad, he could be quite kind, but he was also quite cruel sometimes. Anyhow, he put a curse on that room, and he used it to pass judgement on anyone who he felt needed judging. Anyone who sleeps in that room is cursed. On each of the next five days, they will transform into someone or something else. It can be anything, human, animal or anything else. Sometimes it’s totally random, other times there’s a pattern. It can be something from your nightmares, or from your dreams. Some people even ended up better off. Also, each time you change, your personal history is changed. Everyone except you and I will think that that’s who or what you’ve always been.”

“So, now, everyone else thinks I’ve always been a girl?”

“That’s right. Everyone but you and I believes that you are June Thomson.”

“What happens if I don’t go back to that room tonight?”

“It doesn’t matter where you go, before midnight tonight you’ll be pulled back there.”

“And what happens on the sixth day?”

“On the morning of the sixth day, you will wake up having randomly transformed into one of the forms that you took during the previous five days. That will be your form for the rest of your life. By the time your parents get here on Sunday, even you will have forgotten that you were ever Bobby Thomson.”

“If you knew there was a curse on that room, how could you let me stay in there?”

“I thought it was fixed. After my father died, my mother and I combined our powers to break the curse. And it worked! At least a dozen people have stayed in that room over the years with no problem. I guess our ‘fix’ was only temporary. I’m sorry you had to be the one to find that out.”

“Can’t you fix this?”

“Well, I can’t stop the transformations, but if I cast the proper spell right at midnight on the fifth day, I can interfere with it, so that instead of the final transformation being one of the forms you took during the week, you will instead transform back to normal. Or, at least, somewhat normal.”

“What do you mean by ‘somewhat normal’?”

“Well, you might be a little taller, or have a different hair color, or be a few months older or younger, something like that. I’m sorry, but magic isn’t an exact science. Come to that, it’s not a science at all.”

“Is there anything I can do to help you with that?”, asked Bobby.

“No”, said Marla. “This is something I have to do on my own. I’m afraid that preparations for it’s going to take up a lot of my time for the next few days.”

“What can I do, then?”

“Well, your life is sort of in ‘suspension’ for the next few days. Like it or not, you’re going to be transformed. Why not try being the other people or things that you turn into? Today you’re ‘June Thomson’. Trying being June Thomson, and see what her life is like.”

“How can I do that”” asked Bobby. “I don’t even know her, or who she’s supposed to be.”

“Clear your mind and ‘listen’ mentally. You’ll be able to hear and see June’s memories, and find out the kind of person she is. In fact, if you want to try something really interesting, try and relax completely, and relinquish control of your body. ‘June’ will go about her life without any effort on your part. It’ll be like being a passenger in your own body, but you’ll be able to re-take control whenever you like. Who knows what you might learn?”

“Won’t it freak her out if she suddenly loses control of her body?”

“No. You have to understand, June isn’t a ‘real’ person, just a ‘potential’ one. In a way, it’ll be more like watching a character in a movie.”

“You said I’d forget everything at the end of the five days. What point is there learning stuff that I’ll just forget?”

“You’ll consciously forget. But subconsciously, you may well retain anything important that you learn.”
1413311.title: She believes it's him!

14133111.content:
Bobby thought about it, and said, “OK, I’ll give it a try.” He went back upstairs and sat down on the bed. Clearing his mind, he found June’s thoughts and memories coming into his heads. By concentrating on certain subjects, he found that he could “read” the history of her life, at least as she’d remembered.

June had the same birthday as Bobby, although she was a year younger, 15 instead of 16, as he was. Her earliest memories weren’t too different from his, but as she’d gotten older she’d become somewhat withdrawn, not fitting in well. However, when she got to high school, she’d met Julie Nakamura and become friends with her. Through her, she’d become friends with Ellen Peters, Anne DiGiacomo and Jenna Carlson. Bobby recognized them. They were a clique of goth girls at his high school. Some of the other kids mocked them and called them the “Frightful Four”. Sometimes Bobby had joined in with them. June had taken to the goth lifestyle, and the group were soon known as the “Frightful Five”.

How did she fall in with those freaks?, thought Bobby to himself.

Bobby was startled as he found himself suddenly getting up off the bed. He had relinquished control to “June” without even realizing it! It was a strange sensation, not being in control of his own body.

He decided to see where June would take him. She undressed, and went and stood in front of the mirror for a moment, looking herself over. Then she took some towels out of the closet. Putting on a black bathrobe, she went to the bathroom and took a shower. Afterwards, she dried herself off and then did her hair the way she liked it. She sprinkled herself with baby powder to make herself look pale, then applied black eye and lip make-up.

Then she got dressed in a lacy, black outfit with matching shoes, then looked in the mirror and pronounced herself as “Presentable”. She took out her cellphone and texted Julie, to confirm that the five friends were still on-schedule to get together that day. Then she picked up her handbag and went downstairs again. Marla was still in the kitchen.

“Aunt Marla”, she said, “If it’s OK with you, I’m gonna go down town and hang out with my friends for a while.”

“That’s fine, dear”, said Marla. “”I’m going to be busy all day. Call me if you need anything.”

“Thanks, Auntie, I’ll be back around 6:00. See ya later.”

June left the house and began walking to the bus stop. A coarse voice rang out from across the street.

“Hey, Bride of Frankenstein, nice outfit! HAW! HAW! HAW!”

Another voice chimed in.

“Shame she’s such a freak, she’s got a nice rack!”

It was a pair of teenage boys hanging out. June glared at them briefly, but moved on without saying anything, obviously angry. Bobby winced, inwardly. He’d said stuff like that to girls, before – maybe not so crass, but still pretty unsubtle - never realizing what a jerk he’d sounded like. As June rode the bus, Bobby noticed how many guys – not just boys, but grown men – tried to angle themselves to stare down June’s cleavage. She was aware of it, too. All the times he’d done the same thing, he’d thought he was being so subtle, when obviously the girls had known quite well what he was doing. He was beginning to understand why so many women thought men were pigs. Men were pigs, and he’d been one of them.

Eventually, June arrived at her stop, and got off the bus. She went in to Lotsa Java, a coffee shop that her friends liked to hang out in. She spotted them at a table in the back. They waved at her and she went over to set with them. Bobby listed as the five friends discussed anything and everything. He began to feel bad about having thought of them as ”freaks”. The five girls obviously liked and cared about each other, and were, in fact, intelligent, interesting girls. June, a shy, withdrawn girl had gained a real fellowship with these friends, and had come out of her shell. The more he listened to them, the less the fact that they looked a little “different” mattered to him. He almost wished he could be a part of the group permanently.

Abruptly, Julie looked up and said to the other girls:

“Look out, here comes Buck Studly.”

June looked up, and through her eyes, Bobby saw that “Buck Studly” was Nicky!

Nicky came over to the table, wearing what he no doubt thought was in inviting smile, but which looked more like a leer to Bobby.

“Hey, ladies”, said Nicky, unsubtly flexing his right arm in front of him, “I hate to see you girls sitting all by yourselves, here. Wouldn’t you like some masculine company?”

The five girls looked at one another, and burst into gales of laughter. Nicky walked away, red-faced.

OH. MY. GOD., thought Bobby. I always knew that Nicky’s “Mr. Smooth” act was cheesy, but I never understood what it was like to be on the receiving end of it, before. I never thought you could be goofy and creepy at the same time. If I come out of this intact, I’m going to have to have a word with that boy.

Bobby knew that Nicky was basically a good guy, but he could understand that girls that didn’t know him like he did wouldn’t know that.

Do I sound like that to girls?, thought Bobby. I don’t think I’m that bad, but maybe I am. Is that why Stephanie doesn’t want to go out with me?

The girls brushed the encounter off, and continued their conversation. After a while they left the coffee shop, and then went shopping. After that, they went for a late lunch, and did some more shopping. Eventually, it came time to go home. As June rode the bus back to Marla’s house, Bobby thought over the day.

Those girls are really nice. I had a good time, today. I judged them by their appearance, and I was wrong.

As June re-entered the house, Bobby took control of the body again.

“Aunt Marla, it’s Bobby! I’m home!”

“I’m in the kitchen, dear!”, came her reply.

Bobby joined his aunt in the kitchen.

“How was your day, dear?” she asked.

“I had a really good time” he said. “Much better than I thought I would.”

He helped his aunt make supper. Afterwards, they had a pleasant evening together. Marla told him stories about what life was like when magic was common. Around 10:00 p.m., he found himself yawning. He went up to his room, put on June’s nightgown, and crawled into the bed. Today hadn’t been so bad. Maybe he could enjoy this week!

The next day, he woke up as...
14133111.title: Bobby Decides to Try

141331111.content: On Tuesday, he woke up in a bright, sunlit room. He quickly realized that he wasn’t in the bed, anymore. He was wrapped in pink blankets. Something seemed to wrong with his perspective. It took him to realize what it was. He was in a crib! He was a baby!
141331111.title: A Baby!

1413311111.content:
Someone came into the room – it was his mom! She lifted him out of the crib and held him in her arms.

“How’s my little girl, today?”, she said. “How’s my little Ginny-Winny?” Well, apparently, he was a girl again.

Good grief, thought Bobby. Why do people talk to babies like they’re idiots?

He thought about speaking to her in plain English just to watch her reaction.
1413311111.title: A quiet day for baby...

14133111112.content:
He decided not to do it. His mother placed little Ginny on a table, and checked her diaper. It turned out that she needed a change, so she changed her diaper, and the less said about that the better. Then she gave her a bottle to feed him.

Just as well, he thought. I don’t think I’m psychologically prepared to deal with the alternative.

A baby’s day turned out to be fairly uninteresting. He picked up a little by listening to conversations around him. He was only about three months old, and his arrival had been a bit of a surprise. Around 10:00 a.m., Mary McNair, a friend of his mother’s, came by for a visit.

“Really, Jeannie, imagine having a baby at your age!” said Mary. His mother was in her late 40’s. “You were lucky you both came through it so well.”

“Yes”, said his mother. “You know, Phil and I tried so hard for years to have a baby. The doctors never found anything wrong, but it just never happened for us. We even thought about adopting, but we never did. Then, one day last summer, I noticed that I was starting to get sick in the mornings. I never imagined it was morning sickness, so when Doctor Osterman told me I was pregnant, I thought he was crazy! My little miracle baby!”

Bobby thought about this. He’d been born when his parents had been married for about nine or ten years. While he’d never really discussed it with his parents, he’d picked up enough over the years to know that they would have liked to have had more kids, but that there were physical “difficulties”. He wondered again what it would have been like to have had brothers and sisters.

The rest of the day was fairly dull. Being a baby wasn’t really all that intellectually stimulating. He remembered a character from a movie his dad liked, Who Framed Roger Rabbit. One of the characters was unhappy because he had an adult’s mind permanently trapped in a baby’s body. Bobby understood how he felt.

Eventually the day ended. It had been a learning experience of sorts, and made him hope he wouldn’t have to be a baby again, even if he wouldn’t remember being a teenager. In the evening, he dozed. When he woke up again, it was dark, and he was back in the bed at Aunt Marla’s house. She was sitting in a chair next to the bed.

“We only have a few minutes to talk before the next transformation. So, you were a baby today.”

Bobby tried to speak, but had difficulty getting his mouth to form the words.

“You don’t have to speak”, said Marla. “I can hear your thoughts.”

Bobby mentally told her about his day.

“Interesting”, said Marla. “I wonder if you’re following a pattern. You seem to be transforming into other children your parents might have had.”

Bobby didn’t hear anything else she said, as he soon drifted off to sleep.

The next day, he woke up as...
14133111112.title: He doesn't try it

141331111121.content:
On Wednesday morning, he woke up on what felt like the softest, fluffiest pillow he had ever known. When he opened his eyes, everything looked funny – the colors all seemed sort of washed out. On the other hand, he seemed to be able to smell all sorts of things he’d never noticed before. He looked around. The room seemed familiar, somehow. After a minute, he realized what it was. He was in his own bedroom at home, but it was furnished differently.

When he tried to stand up, he realized that his legs felt funny. He looked down at himself, and then yelped in shock – he was a dog! He had to get a look at himself. Walking on four legs took a little getting used to, but he managed t after a moment. Fortunately the door was open, so he was able to wander over to the bathroom, where there was a full-length mirror on the back of the door. He barked when he saw himself.


He was...
141331111121.title: ...A dog!

1413311111211.content:
He was a Jack Russell Terrier!

At that moment, he heard a voice that he recognized as his mother’s.

“Mitzi? Where are you, sweetie? Come to Mama!”

Bobby had a sneaking suspicion that he knew who Mitzi was. He relinquished control of the body, and sure enough, the dog went running down the hall, wagging its tail, frantically. His mother was waiting in the kitchen. She scooped the dog up in her arms.

“Oh, who’s Mama’s little girl? Who’s Mama’s little girl?”

Bobby winced, inwardly. He was grateful that Nicky wasn’t here to see this: He was now literally a little bitch!

“Time to take you outside”, said his mother. Let’s get you dressed.”

Dressed?, thought Bobby. Oh, great, my mom is one of those people who puts clothes on dogs.

Jeannie put a sweater on Mitzi, and then accompanied her out the back door. Then she took the dog out into the backyard. Mitzi did her business, which Bobby tried not the think about. Then Jeannie brought her back into the house, and gave her some breakfast. The dog food tasted surprisingly good.

I guess those commercials are true, thought Bobby. Dog really do love this stuff!

After breakfast, Bobby took control again and wandered around the house. He looked through all of the rooms that he could get into, but saw no signs that any people besides his parents lived there. He thought about this for a while. Marla had theorized that he was transforming into children his parents might have had instead of him. Well, some people thought of their pets as their “children”, so he supposed it might still fit the pattern. His parents had no actual children, so the dog had become their “baby”.

He tried to probe Mitzi’s memories, found them hard to interpret. She definitely felt affection for his parents, especially for his mother. She seemed to have had a pretty good life for a dog. He went downstairs again, and sought out his mother. She was in her home office, working. She stopped to pet him.

“I’m sorry, little girl, but Mama’s got to work right now. Would you like to go play out in the yard?”

Bobby wagged Mitzi’s tail, eagerly. Jeannie let the dog out into the back yard, which was fenced in. She set out a bowl of water, patted Mitzi on the head, then went back inside. Bobby relinquished control again, curious to see what the dog would do.

Mitzi patrolled the yard, seeming to examine every twig and blade of grass. Once, she’d taken off like a rocket to chase a squirrel up a tree, barking furiously while it chittered down sciurine abuse. After a while, she sat down and basked in the sun.

Well, at least dogs have more interesting lives than babies, thought Bobby.

At lunchtime, Jeannie came outside and sat with Mitzi while she ate. After lunch, Jeannie played with Mitzi, tossing a ball to her. Then she went back inside to do her afternoon’s work. Bobby thought about how weird his situation was. It was a wonder he wasn’t going crazy. He could only hope that Marla would be able to fix it all. It was interesting being different people (and a dog), but he wanted to be himself!

Later, Jeannie brought the dog back into the house for supper. Soon, Phil, Bobby’s dad, came home. He greeted the dog amiably enough, then sat down to his own supper. Afterwards, his parents sat down on the living room couch to watch TV, with Mitzi on the couch between them. Later, Phil put a leash on Mitzi and took her out for a walk. While they were walking, Phil told Mitzi about things he was concerned about, knowing she would never betray his confidence. Bobby enjoyed this, although he missed being able to talk to his dad man-to-man.

When they got back, Jeannie took Mitzi’s sweater and collar off and placed her on her doggie bed, patting her for a while before going off to her own bed. Bobby drifted off, waking briefly when he found himself back at Aunt Marla’s house. He noticed his aunt looking in on him, but drifted off to sleep again before he could speak to her. Who – or what –would he be tomorrow?
1413311111211.title: ..A Jack Russell Terrier

14133111112111.content:
When he woke up Thursday morning, Bobby was in a darkened bedroom. He could see enough to tell that he wasn’t in the bedroom in his aunt’s house. He felt the by now somewhat familiar weight of breasts on his chest. So, he was a girl again! But there was something else, too – his stomach felt oddly rounded and bulky. Just at that moment, he had a strange sensation, as though something in his stomach had kicked him. He was pregnant! The idea that there was someone living inside him was enough to keep him completely weirded out for several minutes.

He heard the sound of breathing, and realized that there was someone in the bed next to him. It was too dark to tell who it was, but from the size, it seemed to be a man. Bobby relaxed his mind, and examined his new form’s memories.

She had been born Karen Thomson, daughter of Phil and Jeannie, 25 years ago.

Another “alternate child”, thought Bobby. She must have been a “honeymoon baby”.

Karen had a reasonably happy childhood. When she’d hit her teenage years, she’d seemed to have more than her share of “teenage angst”, frequently coming into conflict with her mother, who pressured her to have a career like hers. In high school, Karen had and fallen in love with Steve O’Halloran, Nicky’s big brother! Karen had eloped with Steve right after she turned 18. This had caused a rift with her parents, especially her mother. It wasn’t that her mother objected to Steve as such, she had just wanted them to wait, so Karen could complete her education. Steve had gone to work as a mechanic at Peterson’s Garage, and they had taken an apartment together. Karen had gotten an office job, but was soon pregnant. The next year, she gave birth to her daughter, Sarah. Sarah had been followed two years later by their son, Alexander, and two years after that by their second daughter, Jennifer. Now, she was six months pregnant with her fourth child. She’d had various jobs over the last few years, but it had been difficult with one child arriving after another.

Steve was doing very well at the garage – Old Man Peterson liked him a lot – but money was still tight. But then, one day last year, had come a bolt from the blue. She had bought a lottery ticket on a whim, and won a small fortune! It wasn’t quite enough to set them up for life, but it was enough to change their lives completely. They were able to pay off the mortgage on their house, and set up college funds for their kids. Most importantly, Steve was able to buy the garage from Mister Peterson, who was ready to retire, and had no children of his own to pass the business along to. It had also effected a reconciliation with Karen’s parents. Jeannie was an accountant, and Phil a businessman. When they heard the news, both were eager to offer their expertise to Steve and Karen out.

Karen herself helped out with the garage’s paperwork when she could, although taking care of the children ate up a lot of her time, especially this week when school was on vacation.

Bobby relinquished control of the body to see what “Karen” would do.

She leaned over and kissed Steve gently on the cheek. He muttered but did not wake up. She lifted herself awkwardly out of the bed. It hadn’t occurred to Bobby how much pregnancy could throw off a woman’s sense of balance. Her feet felt bloated, too. Their bedroom had a bathroom attached to it. Karen went into the bathroom and got undressed. She stopped for a moment to look at herself in the mirror. To Bobby, she looked a lot like his mother, only her hair was a lighter shade of brown, and was longer, as well. Fortunately, she didn’t seem to be prone to morning sickness.

Karen showered quickly, then threw on a maternity dress and went down to start getting breakfast ready. Bobby laughed inwardly as the thought suddenly occurred to him:

I’m barefoot and pregnant in the kitchen! I thought that was a cliché!

Karen looked up as she heard Steve come downstairs, and they had a quiet conversation over breakfast. It was still ungodly early, and they didn’t want to wake the kids up. After Steve left for work, she had a little quiet time to herself. While Karen relaxed, Bobby probed her memories about her kids. Sarah was six years old and in first grade. She was a very smart little girl and was already reading at an eighth grade level. Alex was four, good-natured and full of energy. Jennifer was two, quiet and very thoughtful for a kid her age.

After resting a bit, Karen went upstairs and set about waking the children. Sarah was able to get herself up and dressed, but Alex generally needed some help, and Jenny needed everything done for her. Karen got the kids up and dressed, then brought them downstairs and gave them breakfast. Bobby had never realized how much effort it took to manage children, even three such well-behaved kids as Karen’s were.

After breakfast, she took the kids out food shopping. By the time they got home, it was just about lunchtime. Just as she was about to start lunch, the doorbell rang. Karen answered the door.

“Mom! What are you doing here? Don’t you have work to do?”

Jeannie smiled, and said:

“Well, I thought you make like a chance to get off your feet and let Grandma lend a hand. I got most of my day’s work done this morning. Plus I bought my laptop, so I might get a little work in this afternoon.”

These visits were a regular occurrence, and Karen sat back as her mother took over the making of lunch. Afterwards, Karen relaxed while Jeannie played with her grandchildren. Naptime came, and Jeannie opened up her laptop, and started going over the garage’s finances with Karen. Bobby was surprised at how quickly his mother turned from “doting Grandma” to “all business” at a moment’s notice. He’d never seen this side of her, and was fascinated by it.

After naptime, Grandma said goodbye to the children and went on her way. Karen got the kids ready and drove over to visit Betty Fleming, a friend of hers from high school, who had two children the same ages as Sarah and Alex. While the children played, Karen and Betty talked over old times. Bobby was astonished at how discreetly raunchy the conversation was. It all sailed far over the children’s heads, but it would have made Bobby blush, if he were in a position to do so. It was weird to hear people’s moms talking that way. Still, he supposed that a woman typically didn’t become a mother without knowing about that sort of thing.

Eventually, Karen noticed that it was getting late, and so she gathered up her children, took her leave of Betty, and headed home. She parked the two older children in front of the TV, and brought Jennifer into the kitchen with her while she prepared supper. Steve came home and the family had their evening meal together.

After supper, she and Steve played with the children for a while, and then it was bath and bedtime. Once the children were in bed, she and Steve went downstairs to sit and talk for a while. It was only when Karen sat down to relax that Bobby realized how tired and footsore she was. Steve surprised her by getting down on the floor in front of her and massaging her feet. It felt really good. Bobby felt weird, like he was intruding on a private moment. Karen drifted off to sleep, and Bobby woke up to find himself back in the bed at Aunt Marla’s house. He looked up and saw her sitting next to the bed. She seemed to know who he had been that day, even though she hadn’t seen him.

“So, you were pregnant for a day?”, she said. “That must have been very strange for you. I can’t imagine what it’s like having someone living inside of you, it’s an experience I’ll never have.”

Bobby looked at this aunt, thoughtfully. He wanted to learn more about why she’d never had kids, but he felt that this wasn’t really the time. Instead, he said:

“I never realized how much work it was, looking after kids, even good kids like Karen’s were. I feel a lot more grateful to my Mom after seeing that.”

His aunt smiled at that, and soon, he fell asleep.

He woke up as...
14133111112111.title: ..A pregnant woman!

choices: Bobby Wants His Old self Back!
141331111121111.content:
When Bobby woke up Friday morning, the first thing he noticed was that he was wearing a frilly, pink nightgown. He felt smaller, and lighter, somehow. He was a girl again, although he guessed he was fairly young. She seemed to have only the beginnings of breasts. Bobby noticed that her skin was a different color, too, a shade or so darker than what he was used to. He looked around. He was still in the bedroom in Aunt Marla’s house.

He got up and looked in the mirror. Looking back was a pretty little Chinese (or at least, Chinese-American) girl, maybe about ten or eleven years old. It occurred to him that every transformation he’d had this week had been female – even the dog. He sat back down on the bed, and probed his new form’s memories. She was Grace Thomson, and was eleven years old. Phil and Jeannie had adopted her from China when she was a baby. She had learned that she was adopted when she was fairly young. Bobby supposed that was inevitable when the adopted kid was from a different ethnic background.

Grace seemed to have led a relatively normal life. She loved and knew that she was loved by her adoptive parents. She had several good friends and enjoyed the usual things that a girl her age enjoyed. It hadn’t always been a bed of roses, of course. In addition to the usual issues that an adopted child had to deal with, she’d had to deal with a certain amount of racism, too. Bobby was shocked at some of the things people - even adults, who should know better - had said to her or in front of her over the years. He felt that he had a reasonably clean conscience there – his parents had brought him up to treat everyone the same, and he honestly couldn’t think of any bad racist remarks he had made. He hoped he wasn’t just rationalizing there, though, and began second-guessing himself.

Grace had also had some issues of identity, which would never have occurred to Bobby. Sometimes it could be hard for her, looking different fr0m everyone she loved. This was a new concept to Bobby, who looked rather like a younger clone of his father, Phil. Grace had one close friend of Chinese ancestry, her classmate Alice Wang. People who saw them playing together would sometimes mistake them for sisters. Phil and Jeannie made an effort to get to know Alice’s parents, who helped the Thomsons as they tried to teach Grace something about Chinese culture, so she could know about her ethnic heritage.

Bobby relinquished control of the body. Grace got up off the bed, threw on a bathrobe, and then went and showered. Afterwards, she came back to the room and got dressed. It turned out that Grace was something of a girly girl, and liked her clothing pink and frilly. Even her 3DS was pink!

Wow, thought Bobby, She looks like a cross between a princess and a cupcake!

Bobby resumed control of the body and went downstairs to find his aunt preparing breakfast.

“Morning, Aunt Marla”, he said.

Marla turned and looked at him.

“My, don’t you look sweet”, she said, “I could just eat you up!”

Bobby drew back in mock terror.

“So, witches do eat little children!”

“No, we don’t”, not really”, said Marla. “At least, not anymore”, she added with a wink.

“So”, asked Bobby. “How are your preparations for tonight coming along?”

“Well enough”, said Marla. “I should be done this morning. I was thinking we could spend the afternoon together, maybe go out for lunch.”

“That sounds great”, replied Booby. “I’m really looking forward to it.”

After breakfast, Bobby relinquished control of Grace’s body, curious to see how she spent her time. Since she was too young to go down town by herself, she went into the parlor to watch TV.

Funny how families have “living rooms”, but aunts have ”parlors”, thought Bobby.

Grace watched one of Aunt Marla’s anime DVD’s. Bobby was amused to find that his aunt, a 400 year old witch, was apparently a Sailor Moon fan!

One “magical girl” likes another, I guess!, he thought.

Eventually, Marla came in and sat down and watched the end of the DVD with Grace. Bobby resumed control of Grace’s body, and said:

“Everything ready”?”

“Yes”, said Marla, “I’m as ready as I’ll ever be. Now, how about some lunch?”

Marla drove them to a nearby restaurant, where they each had a cheeseburger and fries. Aftewrards, she drove them to Overlook Point, where, as the name suggested, it was possible to get an overview of the whole town. They took in the view for a while, until Marla finally spoke.

“I haven’t had much time to talk to you this week. Have you been learning much?”

“Yeah, I have”, replied Bobby. “I’ve really gotten a different perspective on life. You know, I’m wish they were real – I feel like I’ve been introduced to several interesting people – and a dog – and then told I could never see them again. I wish they were really part of my family, so I could get to know them.”

“Well, you know, you still may end up being one of them. I can’t give a 100% guarantee that I can get you back to the old you again. Is there any one of them that you especially like? It might be easier to guide you to that form than to try to get your original body back.”

Bobby thought about it and decided...
141331111121111.title: ...A Young Asian Girl

1413311111211111.content:
“I think I’d like to be one of them, you know? Live as them, or in them or however this works.”

Marla wore a proud smile as she looked at Bobby. “You’ve changed a whole lot over the past few days, Bobby. I’m glad I could help.” Bobby beamed. He turned his head towards the town.

“So, um...” He stumbled over his words. He shook his head, and started over. “So what am I supposed to do?”

“Just tell me who you’d like to be, and you’ll wake up as them tomorrow morning.”

“Simple as that?”

Marla laughed a little. “Simple as that,” she repeated with a shrug.

“Okay.” Bobby took a deep breath. This was a big decision, one he wasn’t even sure he should be making. He clenched his small fist, and steeled his nerves. “I’d like to be...”
1413311111211111.title: Bobby Decides to Choose

1413311111211112.content:
“No”, said Bobby, “I appreciate that there’s a risk, but I want to at least try to get back to normal – or at least, ‘somewhat normal’.”

“I understand”, said Marla. “You want to get back to your old self and your old friends. I saw that picture of you with Nicky and Stephanie. Is she your girlfriend?”

“I wish!”, said Bobby. “I love her, and she likes me a lot, but she’s made it clear that she doesn’t want a ‘romantic’ relationship.”

“Why do you think that is?”, asked Marla.

“I really don’t know”, said Bobby. “Nicky says she’s a lesbian, but then he says that about any girl who doesn’t like him, so I figured he was – you know – projecting.”

“Maybe he is”, said Marla. ”But that doesn’t necessarily mean that he’s wrong. Are you sure she isn’t?”

“No! She can’t be!”, said Bobby, with more vehemence than he had intended.” More calmly, he said, “I mean, she doesn’t look or act like a lesbian.”

“Well, you know, Bobby”, said Marla, “In four hundred years, I’ve known a lot of women like that, and most of them didn’t look or act like what you might think. Are you sure you’re not just afraid that Nicky might be right?”

“Maybe”, said Bobby reluctantly. “But I wish that I could be the one she needs the way she’s the one that I need.”

Then, eager to change the subject, he said:

“What about you, Auntie, what would you wish for?”

Understanding Bobby’s need to talk about something else, Marla sat back and looked thoughtful.

“I mostly have what I want. The only thing I don’t have that I’ve always wanted is children of my own. I’d gladly give up all of my magic to have a nice, normal family.”

“If you don’t mind me asking – if it’s not too personal…” Bobby hesitated.

“Go ahead”, said Marla.

“Why couldn’t you have kids of your own?”

“Hybrids between magical and mundane beings, they…they don’t end well.”

“Oh. Couldn’t you have adopted?”

“It would have been dangerous to have a non-magical child in the house with my magical items. Plus, any kid I adopted, I would almost certainly outlive them. As it is, barring accidents, I’ll outlive Joe by a long time. I hadn’t really thought that through when I married him.”

“I’m sorry”, said Bobby. “I didn’t mean to bring up something sad.”

“That’s alright, dear. Anyway, Joe’ll be back tomorrow afternoon, he always cheers me up.”

They drove back to Marla’s house. Marla sat and watched a DVD together. Later, they had dinner. After dinner, Bobby played Parcheesi with his aunt, the way they had when he was little. Eventually, bedtime came. Bobby changed into Grace’s nightgown, and got into bed. Marla came into the room, carrying a bag containing various magical potions and implements. Marla raised her arms and spoke a few words. Bobby’s body instantly went completely numb.

“Sorry”, said Marla, “but I need to make sure that you remain completely still. Plus, there might be some…disturbing sensations during the night, and I’d rather spare you that. Don’t worry, it’ll wear off shortly after you wake up. Now, sleep.”

Bobby immediately fell into a deep sleep, disturbed only once during the night, when he had a distinct impression of someone screaming in the distance.

The next morning he found...
1413311111211112.title: Bobby Wants His Old Self Back!

14133111112111122.content:
When he woke up Saturday morning, he was still almost completely numb. He could just about feel that he had arms, legs and a head, but that was it. He managed to open his eyes. Marla was sitting next to the bed. She looked a little tired, but otherwise OK. He tried to speak. His voice sounded wrong, somehow. Probably his vocal cords were still half numb.

“What…happened?”

“I’m not a hundred percent sure, myself”, his aunt said. “There was something like a magical power surge when I tried to tamper with the spell. There were unexpected side effects.”

Before Bobby could ask anything else, he heard a chorus of raucous laughter from somewhere else in the house.

“Who’s…that?”

“Oh, that’s just your sisters and your cousins making breakfast. I hope you like pancakes, because they’re making enough to feed an army.”


“My…WHAT?”

Marla shook her head in disbelief.

“I don’t know how it happened – I never imagined it could happen – but all of those people that you were during the week – Karen (and her children), June, Grace, Ginny, even Mitzi the dog – all those ‘potential people’ – the spell re-wrote reality so that they’re all actual people now. You’re no longer an only child, you have four sisters. You wished you could spend more time with those people –well, your wish has been granted!”

Bobby lay in the bed in shock as his aunt continued speaking.

“And the spell granted my wish, too! I’m not a witch, anymore”, she said, in wonder. “I’m just a mundane 39 year-old women. I’m your mother’s sister for real, now, and this is the only face I’ve ever had. In fact, my life has been re-written so that I never was anything else. All of my grimoires and potions are gone, and this house was built in 1945! As far as I can tell, there’s no magic left in the world - not in me, and not in this house. It all burned itself out last night - the fact that we can remember it is just like a fading echo. By tomorrow, we’ll have forgotten it, too. But I don’t mind,” and here Marla smiled radiantly, “I have four children: Samuel - aged 17, Janet - aged 15, Billy – aged 10, and Miranda – aged 8. And I’m three months along with number five!” She patted her slightly bulging belly. “That’s all the magic I need!”

Bobby was genuinely glad for his aunt. He’d always loved her, and he was overjoyed for her. But, he couldn’t help coming back to his own situation.

“Glad…for you…Auntie….but…”

Marla sighed, and looked a little sheepish.

“But you want to know whether you’re back to normal.”

“Yes.”

His aunt looked at him and said...
14133111112111122.title: Something Unexpected Happened

141331111121111222.content:
“Well, you’re back to…well... ‘somewhat normal’. I think I’d better just show you. Let me help you up. Moving around will help you shake the numbness off faster.”

Marla helped Bobby to a sitting position, and then to his feet. With her help, he was able to walk over to the mirror. The numbness faded a little with each step. When he got to the mirror, Bobby gasped in shock.

He was...
141331111121111222.title: You're  only "somewhat" normal...

1413311111211112221.content:
It was true that there was a great deal that was familiar in the reflection he saw. He was wearing his ratty old green bathrobe again, and his hair and eye colors were back to normal. Even his facial features were largely familiar. There was just one major difference: He was a girl!

A name popped into his head: “Bobbi”.

Bobby looked at Bobbi in the mirror. If Bobby had had a twin sister, she would have looked like Bobbi. She was a few inches shorter than Bobby, fit – athletic, even – but definitely feminine with curvy hips and small but respectable breasts. She was quite pretty, actually, if he said so himself.

Something made him look over at the photo he had placed on the bureau. It was different, and yet similar. Nicky was still wearing his basketball uniform, and Bobbi was wearing the uniform of the girls’ basketball team. Nicky was looking on, amused, as Stephanie, her arms draped around Bobbi’s neck, was planting a big kiss on Bobbi’s cheek. Bobbi, unsurprisingly, was grinning like the world’s happiest idiot.

Oh, my God!, he thought. Does this mean - ?

The paralysis had largely passed, and when he spoke his voice was feminine and firm.

“I need to find out who she is”, he said, walking over and plopping himself down on the bed.

Marla nodded. “I understand. I had to do the same, myself. I’ll leave you alone for a while. I should go make sure that my children and other nieces haven’t set the kitchen on fire.”

So saying, she left the room.

Other nieces? I guess I’m a “niece”, now., thought Bobby. That’ll take some getting used to.

Bobby lay on the bed, and thought about his family history, as he remembered it. His parents, Philip Thomson and Jean Hartford, had been married in late April 1990, and he - Robert Thomson - had been born in June 1999. He would be turning 17 in a few months time. He relaxed and let Bobbi’s memories flow into his mind.

Bobbi knew from her family history that Jeannie had become pregnant almost immediately after getting married, and Karen had been born in January of 1991. Roberta Thomson had come along in June 1999, on the exact same day at the exact same time as Bobby had. June had been born almost precisely one year after Bobbi. Grace had been born in August of 2004, although Phil and Jeannie hadn’t brought her home until February of 2015. Virginia, known as “Ginny”, had been born in December 2015. Mitzi the dog had been part of the family for about two years now.

Bobbi’s early memories were similar to Bobby’s. She’d met Nicky when they were toddlers, and they had become buddies, and were still, although Bobbi had given Nicky a few “suggestions” about treating women respectfully over the years. From an early age, Bobbi had not likes “girly” stuff. Not that she wanted to be a guy – she was a girl and was happy to be a girl – but she never wanted to be “girly”. She had no use for frills and bows, and had never wanted to be a princess. This was much to the chagrin of her older sister Karen, who went through a phase of wanting to dress her little sister up like a doll.

As Bobbi got older, she began to realize that she liked girls the way other girls liked boys. Any doubts she might have had were removed when she got to high school and met Stephanie. Bobbi fell for her like a ton of bricks, just as Bobby had. However, where Bobby had been afraid that Stephanie might be a lesbian, Bobbi had been afraid that she wasn’t! Bobbi had known Stephanie for six months before she worked up the nerve to come out to her. It had been a clear day. The two had gone for a bike ride to the park. Sitting in a secluded corner, Bobbi had struggled to get out the right words, only to have Stephanie come out to her first, and confess that she had a huge crush on Bobbi! It had been a scene straight out of a yuri manga. They had been a couple ever since.

Bobbi and Stephanie had given one another the moral support to come out to their parents. Phil had taken it with the equanimity with which he took just about everything. Jeannie had taken it well, also. Bobbi suspected that the fact that Karen had already begun producing grandchildren probably helped there, too. Pete and Isabelle Belanger took it well, too. It helped that the Thomsons liked Stephanie, and the Belangers liked Bobbi. Phil and Jeannie met with Pete and Isabelle to discuss the situation, and the two couples had become good friends. Their relationship was something of an “open secret” among their friends and schoolmates. Most of them were cool with it. Nicky claimed to have known all along that it would happen.

Things had gone so smoothly that, Bobby, reviewing Bobbi’s memories, had to wonder whether it was the effect of the spell.

For the last week, Bobbi had been hanging out with her cousins and younger sisters, sending Stephanie the occasional longing text message. Her parents were not in Paris, but instead had taken little Ginny down south to visit Phil’s relatives.

Bobby sighed. So, the spell had granted his other wish as well – it had made him the person that Stephanie wanted the way he wanted her, only not in the way he would have chosen!

Marla came back after a while, and Bobby told her what he had learned.

“It’s strange to think that by tomorrow, neither of us will remember that this wasn’t the way it always was”, he said.

“That’s probably for the best”, said Marla. “Anyway, why don’t you come down and have some breakfast?”

“OK”, said Bobby. “I think I’ll let her have the ‘reins’. I’m curious to see her interact with her family.”

“You understand that after a few hours, you won’t be able to take the reins back?”

“I know”, he said. “Nothing can stop that now. While I’m still ‘me’, Auntie, I want to tell you that I love you. You’ve always been everything a guy – or a girl – could want in an aunt.”

“I love you, too, Bobby, and I will continue to love you, no matter what form you wear.”

The two embraced, and Marla left the room.

Bobby relinquished control of the body, and Bobbi got up and went and showered. While she bathed and then dressed herself, he thought over his current situation.

It won’t be so bad of a life, he imagined. I got the girl I wanted, after all!

Bobbi threw on a tee-shirt, jeans and sneakers (not that different from what Bobby would have worn), and went downstairs. June and Grace were still eating breakfast, as were their cousins Janet and Miranda. Grace looked up as Bobbi came in.

“Good morning, Big Brother”, she said. (This was her more-or-less affectionate nickname for Bobbi.)

“Morning, LCP”, Bobbi said. (This was short for “Lolita Cupcake Princess”, Bobbi’s nickname for Grace. “C’mere, you,” she continued, grabbing her little sister in a bearhug, and kissing her on the cheek.”

“Ah, get offa me, ya perv!” said Grace.

“Aw, you know you love it”, said Bobbi, tousling her sister’s hair as she released her. Bobbi smiled across the table at June, who smiled back.

“Mornin’, freak”, they said simultaneously, and laughed.

Mitzi came into the room, barking enthusiastically. Bobbi stooped to pat the dog for a moment.

“Good morning, cousins!”, said Bobbi to Janet and Miranda, before serving herself a plateful of food, and settling down to eat it.

It was a busy morning in the Vercotti household. Joe would be arriving home later in the afternoon. Phil, Jeannie and Ginny were due to arrive later that night, and would be coming over tomorrow for a big Sunday dinner, along with the O’Hallorans and Belangers. There was food and drink to be purchased, and a house to be cleaned. Children and cousins alike were recruited to help, and Bobbi was busy all morning.

Caught up in the activity, Bobby didn’t even notice as his personality was slowly subsumed into Bobbi’s. By the time Bobbi sat down for lunch, the idea that there had even been a separate person called ”Bobby Thomson” had begun to seem unreal to her.

Uncle Joe came home around 3:00 p.m. Everyone stopped working to greet him. Bobbi had always gotten along well with her uncle, who was a happy, friendly man who loved to talk sports with her. Giuseppe Vercotti was a big, burly man with an honest face and rugged good looks.
1413311111211112221.title: ..A female version of his old self!

choices: Something unexpected - there's still some magic in the world?
14133111112111122211.content:
He greeted her with a hug and a loud, “Ciao, bella Roberta!” Bobbi didn’t usually like being called “Roberta” – Joe was the only person that she didn’t mind it from.

“Hey, Uncle Joe”, she said, “How was your golf trip?”

“Great, great,” he said, “But I missed my family, so I was glad to come home.”

Joe regaled Bobbi and her cousins Sam and Billy with stories of his adventures in golf until, after a while, Marla came in prodded the children to get back to work helping with preparations for the next day’s dinner. Joe went upstairs for a nap.

In the early evening , they ate supper, which was a loud and raucous occasion. Afterwards, Bobbi snuck upstairs for a moment to go on-line and check her messages. There was a brief little love note from Stephanie which she answered, but Stephanie was not currently on-line. By this point, Bobbi had only odd, fading memories of “Bobby”. What a weird dream that was, she thought. She heard a call from downstairs and went and re-joined her family. They spent the rest of the evening playing games, which resulted in the usual good humor and occasional near-mayhem.

Jeannie called around 10:00 p.m. to let everyone know that she, Phil and Ginny had arrived home safely. Soon afterwards, the children began drifting off to bed. Bobbi pulled on her ratty green bathrobe and crawled under the covers. Before drifting off to sleep, she reflected on the fun she’d had with her family.

They’re all completely nuts, but I love every last one of them.

Sunday morning, Bobbi woke up early. She had a brief moment where she thought she’d forgotten something, but it soon passed. She got up and quietly bathed and got dressed, then went and sat out on the back porch. In time, she was joined by her uncles, who handed her one of the two mugs of coffee he was holding. She sipped it gingerly – you had to be careful, you could raise the dead with Joe’s coffee, he made it so strong.

The two sat in companionable silence – Bobbi loved someone that she could just sit quietly with. Eventually, there was a sound of movement from within the house. Joe sighed and drained his coffee.

“That’ll be Marla”, he said. “We better go in and help her make breakfast.”

Bobbi drained her mug and followed him in. Breakfast was also a raucous affair. Her family just didn’t do quiet meals.

Steve and Karen arrived around 10:30 to help with preparations, bringing their children, Nicky and Mrs. O’ Halloran, Nicky and Steve’s mother, with them. When they arrived, Bobbi, June and Grace were straightening up the dining room. Karen walked in. She was holding Jennifer in her arms and Sarah was following right behind her. Karen surveyed her sisters, who were dressed in their usual goth, lolita and tomboy finery.

“Look, Sarah”, said Karen, “Your aunts are putting on a seminar on how not to dress like a normal girl.”

“Well, we can’t all rock maternity wear the way you do, Karen”, said Bobbi.

“Yeah”, added June, “’Frumpy’ is an ‘interesting’ style choice, but it’s not for everyone.”

“Some of us just prefer to look elegant”, said Grace.

“Ah, well”, said Karen, “Maybe Ginny will know how to dress.” Turning to Sarah, she said, “Why don’t you stay with your aunties for a while? I’m sure they’d like to spend some time with you.”

“As a matter of fact, we would”, said Bobbi. They all liked Sarah. She was a fun kid. Nicky came in to say hello shortly afterwards, before going out back to shoot hoops with Bobbi’s cousin Sam.

Phil, Jeannie and Ginny arrived around noon, and the girls all rushed to greet their parents.

“Look at all my girls”, said Jeannie. “Let’s get a picture of you all together.”

Dutifully, her daughters lined up against the wall. Karen stood in the middle, holding Ginny in her arms. June stood to her right, and Grace stood to her left. Bobbi, in her turn, stood to Grace’s left. Jeannie took the photo using her phone, and showed it to Bobbi afterwards. Bobbi looked at the photo – it had come out really well. They all looked and were smiling – even the baby. She felt a wave of affection for her sisters. For all their flaws, she loved them deeply. She couldn’t imagine being an only child. How lonely that would be!

“Mom, definitely send me a copy of that”, she said. She would print it out and have it framed.

Marla soon put Bobbi to work in the kitchen. Bobbi didn’t mind. She was a talented cook, if she said so herself, and it was something she enjoyed. She was alone in the kitchen, wearing an apron and a kerchief and stirring a pot of spaghetti when suddenly, familiar arms gently encircled her waist, familiar lips kissed her left cheek, and a familiar voice whispered in her ear:

“I love seeing my woman being all domestic, it gets me all…excited.”

The speaker punctuated this sentence by breathing softly into Bobbi’s left ear. Bobbi wriggled with pleasure and turned to return Stephanie’s kiss with interest. Stephanie had just arrived with her parents and sister, and had decided to surprise Bobbi.

Their reunion was interrupted after a few minutes by an indignant-sounding voice.

“Knock it off, you horndogs, before you traumatize some poor, innocent child”, said Grace.

Bobbi stifled her irritation and replied, “Why, is there one around here somewhere?”

Grace ignored this and said, “Mom sent me out here to help you with the cooking.”

Yeah, right, thought Bobbi. Mom sent you out here to play chaperone.

Aloud, she said, “Alright, then, clean and cut up those potatoes. “

“Here, I’ll help”, said Stephanie. She and Grace sat down and got to work.

“I just don’t get it”, said Grace. “I can’t imagine wanting to play kissyface with either a boy or a girl.”

“Well, the good news is, you don’t have to if you don’t want to”, said Bobbi.

“You may find yourself changing your mind in a few years, though”, said Stephanie.

“I dunno”, said Grace. “I’m very particular, you know.”

“As well you should be”, said Bobbi.

In time, the whole collection of family and friends gathered for dinner. Joe proposed a toast. Everyone raised their glasses (the non-pregnant adults drank wine, everyone else drank lemonade):

“To my family and friends: It is so nice to come home and find you all unchanged. You’re still the nicest group of people a man could hope to know!”

Everyone toasted him in return. The family had their usual raucous dinner. Afterwards, they socialized while with the clean-up. Eventually, it came time to go home. As usual, the goodbyes took nearly an hour. Bobbi managed to steal a private moment with Stephanie to give her a personal “parting gift”.

She also took a moment to say goodbye to Marla.

“Thanks for putting up with us, Auntie”, she said.

“Oh, I was glad to, dear”, said Marla. “I’m only sorry it was so uneventful.”

At last, Bobbi was home in her own room in her own house. After unpacking, she got ready to go back to school the next day. Fortunately, she had done all of her schoolwork during quiet moments at her aunt’s house.
14133111112111122211.title: He recognizes Bobbi

141331111121111222111.content:
And so life went on. In three months, Karen had another daughter, Patricia, and three months after that, Marla had another daughter of her own, Josephine. Bobbi eventually turned her love of cooking into a career as a chef, and Stephanie became a successful graphic artist. They stayed together, and, while they never had any kids of their own, they were doting aunts to their sisters’ offspring.

One day, many years later, when they were babysitting Grace’s eight year-old daughter, Janice, Stephanie turned to Bobbi and asked:

“Babe, do you ever think about what it would have been like if youd’ve had a different life? Like, if you’d magically been turned into somebody else?”

“What brings this on?”, asked Bobbi.

“Well, earlier, I was reading a book to Janice – it was while someone had dozed off on the couch, leaving me to entertain our niece. Anyway, it was a sequel to The Wizard of Oz, and the main character is a boy who ends up being magically turned into a girl.”

“Hah!”, said Bobbi. “Well I never was a boy, and anyway, there’s no such thing as magic!”

A ray of sunlight fell across the face of young Bobby, waking "him" from his slumber. The sun flooded his open window, signaling that the day had moved on from dawn and had proceeded to full-on daytime. Bobby remembered what his aunt had told him the day before. That he would spend the entire week transforming daily, though to what exactly he would transform into seemed to be an unknowable thing, up to some divine deity.(Or a particularly bored writer.) With this thought, Bobby decided to play a bit of a game. He would close his eyes, walk up to the full-length mirror just across the room, and try to figure out what exactly he had been turned into. Thinking this was a great idea. (And rather interested to see for himself.) Bobby closed his eyes, swung his feet off the coverings of his bed, and stood up.

Immediately, Bobby could guess some things about who he had been transformed into. He felt human,(A rather massive relief, if he was being honest.) and from the two weights on his chest and the feeling of nothing between his legs, Bobby could also guess that he was she. "Great... Again? Am I just supposed to take this as a lesson for some sort of past misdeed? Or is this whole thing really just random and I got unlucky? Whatever, guess I need to see for myself. With a flourish, he opened his eyes to see... Nothing. At least nothing concrete, with only blobs of color being visible. "I guess I need glasses. I know that Aunt Marla had a pair on the bedside table.” retrieving the glasses, she finally turned to the mirror to see the girl she had become.

The very first thing she noticed was the long, dark brown hair, flowing down to her shoulders, just covering her chest. He noticed that it had a slightly greasy quality, as if it hadn't been washed in a few days. Her face was an undersized, but well formed, scrunched up in a small smile. Despite her best intentions, he also noticed a few small pimples around the corner of her mouth, and the small, flighty movements her eyes seemed to involuntary make every ten seconds or so. Starting to work her way downward, she next took stock of her chest. If anything, her tits seemed to be slightly larger than they were the day before, (Something Bobby was secretly happy about.) But also hung lower than they did before. Slowly massaging her boobs, she also noticed that they were more filled with fat, seemingly more the result of food and lack of exercise than good genetics. This theory was confirmed by a look at her stomach, as it bulged out, forming a cute little pot belly that was just starting to hang down over the rest of her. “Oh, great. So not only do I have to spend the day as a girl, I have to spend the day as a chubby girl. I bet she... I... couldn’t do a single lap on a track.” Deciding to go lower, her thighs just started to touch near her privates, even if she stood with her feet under her shoulders, much to her dismay. Finally deciding to turn around, her eyes drifted down to see her rear end. Seeming to fill out her underwear to a nearly comical (or obscene) degree, Bobby promptly decided that maybe this body wasn't all that bad. She playfully gave her ass a slap, and was surprised by just how much is jiggled. Deciding to slap it harder, she yelped and began to feel a warm tingling feeling in her lower region. “Jeez, only that got her..eh..me that aroused? I really must not get action. At all.” Deciding to get dressed for the day, Bobby noted a change from the clothing she had just yesterday. “Not that most of it would fit me now.” Bobby rued softly, lightly patting her belly. The black ensembles had been cast aside in favor of some plain greys, browns, and a few flashes of bright yellow or blue. Even more noteworthy to Bobby was the numerous nerdy catchphrases on the shirts. The catchphrases spanned everything from Star Trek, to anime, to even video games, like Total War and Kingdom Hearts. Glancing around the room, she also noticed that the walls were covered by movie posters, funny quotes, and video game concept art. Video game consoles dominated the TV in the corner, and Bobby could tell that there were at least 2 more handheld consoles on the nightstand beside the bed. “You know, a girl like this would be great to hang out with. I wonder if I have any friends in the nearby town?” Deciding on a Pokemon shirt and some mercifully stretchy sweatpants, Bobby turned back to the mirror. In it, he saw a surprisingly endearing, chubby little nerd. A sort of “girl next door” if that next door was a library or Gamestop. With that final thought, Bobby was ready for the day.

Besides that, he walked over to his closet. There, to which he wasn't surprised, were many clothes befitting that of a middle-aged woman. However, he didn't find anything wrong with that, so he found what he could and put them on.

He found a nice black bra, white blouse, black panties, and jeans. He felt pretty comfortable in them, although part of him pondered about the bra and such like that.

"Oh well, good enough." he said to himself.

As he finished putting everything on, he felt a small surge go through him. He couldn't tell what it was, but it seemed like the room got slightly bigger.

"Huh? What was that?" Bobby asked himself.

The difference between part and all, is that after five days you could return to where you came from, being there as a satyr before changing back to what you were, as are at present. The other possibility is becoming an animal and it is a 70/30 chance you will remain here as an animal, rather than to return home being an animal for five days.

Know this, that of all who came this way and were transformed to being an animal, when they return home as that animal, most tend to return here and stay then an animal. Becoming an animal and returning home, as what we have heard from those returning by choice, their bodies did not revert wholly to being again as human, but they retained a goodly amount of their animals self as a permanent transforming; maybe to remind them they had their chance to stay with us, here on this focal plane."

"Charlene," Bobby said as if to ask a question of her.

info.brief_description: Bobby Thomson is in for a suprising week at his aunt's when he is transformed every day.
info.description:
In this interactive, The teenager known as Bobby Thomson has to spend the week at his Aunt Marla's house while is parents head out of town. Every day of the five days he is staying there, Bobby finds that he has transformed into something else, be it an animal, or an age transformation.

How Bobby transforms is entriely up to you. He can transform slowly through the day, or wake up with his transformation complete. He can transform physically, or only have his perception of him by others changed. (For example, you can have Bobby physically become a baby, or have him keep his teenage body and have everyone think that he is a baby.) You can also choose how Marla reacts to the transformation. She can be shocked, the one who made the transformation happen, or beleive that you are supposed to be this way. This is all entirely up to you.

I suggest that you give people the option to choose other reactions and transformation types so that they can play this story however they want, but you do not have to.

Here are some rules you must follow, however.

- There can only be one transformation a day. Bobby cannot transform again in the middle of the day unless it involves a slow, singluar transformation. Once Bobby falls asleep at night, he must begin a different transformation when he wakes up.
- If a chapter line goes through five different transformations, the story must end with Bobby returned to somewhat normality
- Different age transformations count as different transformations. One day can be middle aged, one can be elderly, and one can be younger, and that is three days of the story.
- Swearing is allowed, but don't fill your chapters with them.
- No Sex
- No Death.
